title: Finishing the Projects you Start
description: This is a polished written version of a talk I have given at meetups and conferences. This article covers effective learning, defining scope, phases of a project, the differences between academic, résumé, & passion projects and how to convert them from one to another.

title: Reducing app distribution size in NW.js
description: A throrough and detailed write up of everything there is to know about optimizing an NW.js desktop app to reduce it's filesize.

title: Properly commenting code. Literal vs Contextual comments
description: Walking through the process of code sketching and refactoring. A practice used to improve variable naming and to provide context for code, resulting in cleaner, more maintainable, self-explanatory code.

title: Quotes about TypeScript
description: An organized and currated list of quotes about the experiences and opinions of the oft controversial meta-language TypeScript based on conversations with others in the industry.

title: Why you should never use .toBe in Jest
description: A write up on why using .toBe() is an anti-pattern in Jest code, and reasons why .toEqual() is a better replacement in every use case.

title: Basic approaches to styling in Vue
description: An entire article written as a .vue single file component to demonstrate various techniques of working with basic styling in a Vue component.

title: Guide to NW.js versions
description: A list of important and historical versions of NW.js and why someone may want to use them.

title: Coverage Badge with GitHub Actions - FINALLY!
description: I published this to document the results of 6 months of research, trial, and error. In that time, I found no other documentation on how to achieve branch specific test coverage badges while using GitHub Actions as your CI. This article is a step-by-stepy process for setting this up on any repo.

title: Combining Angular-CLI with NW.js
description: A step-by-step tutorial of creating a new Angular-CLI app and altering the project to be an NW.js desktop app.

title: Everything you need to know about making Animated GIFs
description: A detailed technical breakdown of how GIF compression works and techniques used by software to improve their quality and lower their filesize.

title: Who want's to date a Pre-Processor! Game Show edition!
description: How do pre-processors (Sass, Less, Stylus) handle parsing/processing modern CSS.

title: Holy shit NW.js is so easy
description: A TLDR style introduction to making a desktop app in under a minute with NW.js.
